messages.subject: Re: An entertaining day
messages.msgSnippet: Nope, I m in Ohio.  We can go either way here.  This year it is wet . . . very wet . . . very very wet.  The neighbors yard has a flowing creek where most of
messages.messageBody:
Nope, I'm in Ohio. We can go either way here. This year it is wet .
. . very wet . . . very very wet. The neighbors yard has a flowing
creek where most of the time it's dry. Our back woods has standing
water everywhere.
Other years, the spring rains are little drizzles. But tomorrow it is
supposed to be sunny and warm so maybe things will at least stop
flowing!

Bridget




--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Lyonness" <Lyonness@k...> wrote:
> <<<I feel like it's time to build an ark!>>>>
>
> either you live in Washington, or you truely don't know what mud
is!!!
> living close to the only rainforest in north america has it's
benefits!
> Lots of green, lots of variety, and webbed feet.
>
> Bec,

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: An entertaining day
messages.messageBody:
<<<I feel like it's time to build an ark!>>>>

either you live in Washington, or you truely don't know what mud is!!!
living close to the only rainforest in north america has it's benefits!
Lots of green, lots of variety, and webbed feet.

Bec,
Camano Island Homeschoolers,
Washington Unschoolers,
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Washingtonunschoolers/

----- Original Message -----
From: rumpleteasermom
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 14, 2002 8:54 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: An entertaining day


--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "joanna514" <Wilkinson6@m...> wrote:

> They would probably have been perfectly happy playing in the dirt
> today. Oh well....
>

We don't have any dirt here. What we have is mud, lots of mud. Even
the dog doesn't want to be out today. I feel like it's time to build
an ark!

Bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] An entertaining day
messages.msgSnippet: I guess they are learning that their mother has a great imagination and enjoys spending time with them and having fun too. Sharon ... From: joanna514
messages.messageBody:
I guess they are learning that their mother has a great imagination and
enjoys spending time with them and having fun too.

Sharon

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] An entertaining day
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/14/02 9:35:50 AM, Wilkinson6@msn.com writes:  They still
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/14/02 9:35:50 AM, Wilkinson6@... writes:

<< They would probably have been perfectly happy playing in the dirt
today. >>

They still have a chance to play in the sand and totally ignore the water and
people and sky and lunch.
Maybe your entertainment won't *entirely* ruin them.

Sandra

messages.subject: An entertaining day
messages.msgSnippet: It s a beautiful day here on the easter shore of Maryland. I m off to entertain my kids with a day on the beach amongst friends. And they didn t even think of
messages.messageBody:
It's a beautiful day here on the easter shore of Maryland.
I'm off to entertain my kids with a day on the beach amongst friends.
And they didn't even think of it themselves.
They would probably have been perfectly happy playing in the dirt
today. Oh well....
Joanna
